activities.loc: Branch 1 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Cases 21CF516, 22CF125(Juarez Mendoza), 22CF126(Alias Trevino), 22CF127(Angel Trevino) called at 2:21pm {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.} 
Defendant David Juarez Mendoza does NOT appear(remains at Green Bay Correctional, facility did not connect at time of hearing).  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger in court for David Juarez Mendoza.  
Defendant Alias R Trevino appeared by zoom from Kettle Moraine Correctional, in custody. Attorney Peter Anderson appears via zoom for Alias R. Trevino.
Defendant Angel Trevino does NOT appear. Attorney Francis Raff appears via zoom for Angel M Trevino.
Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.

As to Case 22CF126, Alias Trevino, Arraignment occurs: 
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

As to Case 22CF127, Angel Trevino: 
Atty Raff indicates he believed Angel Trevino remains in custody on an un-posted Racine Co. cash bond
ADA Teuber requests a quick status be scheduled to learn whereabouts of Angel Trevino

As to Cases 21CF516 & 22CF125, David Juarez Mendoza:
Atty Luchsinger agrees with proposed status date
recess: 2:42pm  

NEXT:   As to Case 22CF126(Alias Trevino): (1) Pretrial Conference on 11/2/22 at 11:00am    (2) Status Conference on 11/7/22 at 2:30pm(all parties may appear via zoom, assuming not dispositive) 
As to Case 22CF127(Angel Trevino): Status Conference on 11/7/22 at 2:30pm(all parties may appear via zoom, assuming not dispositive) 
As to Cases 21CF516 & 22CF125(Juarez Mendoza): Status Conference on 11/7/22 at 2:30pm(all parties may appear via zoom, assuming not dispositive)

The Court directly appointed Attorney Peter Anderson in this case on July 29, 2022. This is not what the Court intended because the Defendant is State Public Defender (SPD) eligible as determined by the SPD. THE COURT ORDERS an appointment by SPD (of Attorney Peter Anderson). The Court recognizes said appointment regardless of any further action or inaction by SPD. This order is made nunc pro tunc to July 29, 2022.

The Court directly appointed Attorney Peter Anderson in this case on July 29, 2022: however, the Defendant is State Public Defender(SPD) eligible as per the SPD Office. 

The Court orders an appointment by SPD (of Attorney Peter Anderson). The Court recognizes this appointment regardless of any further action or inaction by SPD.
Arraignment on September 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[MK] cases #21CF516, #22CF125, #22CF126, #22CF127 called at 10:37am 
Co-Defendant David Juarez Mendoza in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven Luchsinger.
Co-Defendant Alias R Trevino in court, in custody, with Attorney Peter Anderson.
Co-Defendant Angel M. Trevino in court, in custody, with Attorney Francis Raff.
ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance.  

In Case #22CF127 (Angel Trevino) Prelim-Waiver and Arraignment are held: 
--Mr. Angel Trevino waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--service of Information admitted, reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--Attorney Raff indicates that the speedy trial demand is withdrawn. Attorney Raff requests that the [9/7/22] jury trial be removed and the case next scheduled for a status conference.
--The Court notes that Attorney Raff was appointed by the Court as a direct appointment; the Court used the direct-appointment wording in error. This appointment of counsel is to be by the Public Defender's Office.  This is the Court's Order nunc pro tunc to 6/20/22.  
--Attorney Raff indicates that he has instructed Angel Trevino to telephone the PD Office today to re-apply for representation so that PD appointment of counsel can occur.
recess as to case #22CF127 only at 10:47am. [Angel Trevino and Attorney Raff exit the courtroom.]
______________________________

In Cases #22CF125 (Juarez Mendoza) and #22CF126 (Alias Trevino) Preliminary Hearing is held:  
Officer J. Schroeder -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Parson 
--cross examination by Attorney Luchsinger
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Juarez Mendoza and Mr. Alias Trevino committed a felony. The Court binds them over for Trial.
recess as to case #22CF126 only.  [Alias Trevino and Attorney Anderson exit the courtroom.]
_____________________________
In Case #22CF125 (Juarez Mendoza) Arraignment is held:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 11:12am 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference in cases #21CF516 and #22CF125 (Juarez Mendoza) only on September 14th at 10:40am,  (2) Arraignment in Case #22CF126 (Alias Trevino) and Status Conference on all other cases -- all on September 26th at 2:30pm with appearances of the Defendants and Defense counsel by Zoom Conference
